result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: ADA Andrea Raymond appeared for the State. Attorney Haley Ruesch Watson appeared in person with Defn. STC scheduled, NIH.
Status conference on December 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Cell ph number was incorrect; it has been updated by Br 2 so defn will now receive text messages re upcoming court hearings.
Status conference on November 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant pleas not guilty, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

8:48 AM Court reporter Rowan Thompson. Defendant Russell T Byrd in court.  Attorney Haley Ruesch Watson in court for Russell T Byrd.  Attorney Trisha Simmons for Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. Witnss B.G duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Venue established. Defendant identified. Cross by Atty Watson. State moves for bind over, waives argument. Defense objects to bind over, no argument. Court finds probable cause and binds over to branch 2.
Preliminary hearing on September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

02:29 PM Defendant appeared. Trisha L Simmons w/ intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defn qualifies for SPD but atty has not been appt'd yet. Court explained the process to the defn. New date set.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.  - Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required.  - Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a properly functioning ignition interlock device installed. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

08:51 AM Defendant appeared.  Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
